cyclone.name: OMAR
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles south-southwest of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast to east-northeast and forecast to remain offshore, curving out into the open Atlantic south of Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: None – system is forecast to stay over open water

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mainly the Outer Banks of North Carolina for surf and rip-currents; offshore waters of the western Atlantic
weather_observation.time_to_34kt_non_zero: ≈0 h (already non-zero for Cape Hatteras; zero for Canaveral)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected; only typical onshore breezes.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor increase in long-period swells and rip-current risk along the east-central Florida beaches.
